alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 19 at 7:34AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER FROM TULUKSAK TO NAPAKIAK... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Kuskokwim River from Tuluksak to Napakiak. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...The breakup front on the Kuskokwim is progressing steadily downstream along the lower Kuskokwim River. The villages of Tuluksak, Akiak, Akiachak, Kwethluk, Napaskiak, and Napakiak should be prepared for possible flooding. Given the quantity of water coming downstream, even a small ice jam has the potential to create flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ice jam flooding has high uncertainty. Impacts could range between localized high water and severe flooding. Now is the time to take precautions. Where possible, move items to higher ground and prepare your community for possible flooding. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Please stay tuned to weather.gov/Anchorage, NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
